intro: Stenocalyx sulcatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Australia, specifically found in the southeastern regions of the country. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Stenocalyx sulcatus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
